data.title: 11th Street Bridge Park
data.meta_description: 11th Street Bridge Park | 621 followers on LinkedIn. The 11th Street Bridge Park, a project of Ward 8 based nonprofit Building Bridges Across the River at THEARC will be Washington, D.C.‚Äôs first elevated public park located on the piers of the old 11th Street Bridge spanning the Anacostia River: a new venue for healthy recreation; environmental education and the arts. After a seven-month design competition, the design team of OMA+OLIN was selected in October 2014. With the ongoing capital campaign securing more than $15 million to date, Bridge Park draws on extensive community outreach and consultative process, anchored by more than 700 stakeholder meetings for design development and impact.
data.text:
As Parks and Recreation Month comes to an end, we want to celebrate along with our amazing partners at the DC Department of Parks and Recreation and our wonderful collaborators at the National Park Service East. Together, we are so excited to celebrate Parks and Recreation Month by highlighting our efforts to help bring the 11th Street Bridge Park to life. This community civic space, located on the piers of the old 11th Street Bridge, will be a space for healthy recreation, environmental education, and the art #dcbridgepark #parkandrecreationmonth #parkandrecreationmonth2024

Join THEARC-Building Bridges Across the River Farm's exciting workshop to observe honey being extracted from hives and harvested into jars! Each attendee will have the opportunity to try on a bee-keeping suit and get a close look at the open bee box. Fun for all experience levels! üóìÔ∏è Date & Time: Sat, Aug 3, 2024, 8:00 AM - 11:00 AM üìç Location: Allen Chapel AME, Garden of Eden, 2498 Ainger Pl SE, Washington, 20020 üéüÔ∏è Tickets: Participant - $10.00 Register Here: https://lnkd.in/dC689YWG #THEARC #DCBridgePark

Members of #TeamLINK had the pleasure of touring 11th Street Bridge Park today, guided by our friends at Building Bridges Across the River. We were thrilled to learn about a community-driven planning process that led to this iconic project for community gathering and activation! Special thanks to #TeamLINK alumna Laticia Taylor and our friend Scott Kratz for the insightful tour!

Shoutout to LINK Strategic Partners for joining us on our Summer Walking Tour! üåª Want to explore the future site of #DCBridgePark and stay up to date on new developments? üéâ Our next tour is on Thursday, August 22, from 5:30 - 6:30 pm! Register Here: bridgepark.org/tours #DCBridgePark!

Don't miss out! Join us this Saturday from 10 AM - 12 PM for the 11th Street Bridge Park East of the River Homebuyer Club. We'll have guest speakers sharing everything you need to know about the homebuying process and the next steps towards owning your dream home! The first 4 people will win a gift card! Plus, enjoy a free breakfast on us. Get ready, get set, and let's make those homeownership dreams come true! Register Here: https://lnkd.in/eVUMyvhR #dcbridgepark

WE JUST RECEIVED THE PERMIT FROM THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEER!! This moves us closer to #DCBridgePark #Groundbreaking. Our team is beyond excited. This 1 out of 4 remaining permits, the countdown is on! NEXT UP, U.S. Coast Guard. #dcbridgepark

In recognition of National Homeownership Month and as part of a local effort to address systemic barriers to housing, the Wells Fargo Foundation provided our #Ward8 Homebuyers Club $100,000 towards closing cost assistance. Thank you & our partners at Manna INC. for working with us to remove barriers to creating generational wealth. Read the full story: https://lnkd.in/euuMBhMR #dcbridgepark

Thank you, Wells Fargo, for sponsoring this event and supporting health and wellness! Read Here: https://lnkd.in/exBbqW2w #dcbridgepark
